publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4176 Sandra White: Glasgow, Scotland’s Curry Capital—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow’s Indian restaurant sector on its success at this year’s Scottish Curry Awards, which saw the Ashoka restaurant lift the much coveted award of Team of the Year and Jaffar Hussain of the Kabana named Chef of the Year, while the Lifetime Achievement Award was presented to Ali Ahmed Aslam, the founder of the Shish Mahal, one of Glasgow’s first curry houses, and Balbir Singh Sumal, the owner of Balbirs in Glasgow’s cosmopolitan west end, was proclaimed Scotland’s Curry King, and believes that the huge success serves to underline and further enhance Glasgow’s renowned international reputation as a modern, vibrant and multicultural city. Supported by: Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*, Gil Paterson*, Rob Gibson*
S3M-4176 Glasgow, Scotland’s Curry Capital (lodged on 19 May 2009) Stuart McMillan*, Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-4176 Sandra White: Glasgow, Scotland’s Curry Capital—That the Parliament congratulates Glasgow’s Indian restaurant sector on its success at this year’s Scottish Curry Awards, which saw the Ashoka restaurant lift the much coveted award of Team of the Year and Jaffar Hussain of the Kabana named Chef of the Year, while the Lifetime Achievement Award was presented to Ali Ahmed Aslam, the founder of the Shish Mahal, one of Glasgow’s first curry houses, and Balbir Singh Sumal, the owner of Balbirs in Glasgow’s cosmopolitan west end, was proclaimed Scotland’s Curry King, and believes that the huge success serves to underline and further enhance Glasgow’s renowned international reputation as a modern, vibrant and multicultural city. Supported by: Bob Doris, Bill Kidd, Gil Paterson, Rob Gibson, Stuart McMillan, Jamie Hepburn, Pauline McNeill*
